name: NIO Inc.
thesis: High-variance turnaround. The stock embeds skepticism about sustained operating profitability. If NIO reaches durable operating margins without constant dilution, the equity can re-rate sharply. If it doesn't, equity value gets crushed by cash burn and financing.

reverseDCF.interpretation: Market implies ~5.1% terminal EBIT margin (holding Base growth path), or delivery growth that's only 41% of the Base scenario. Either way — modest expectations.

risks.title: Margin compression
risks.detail: Renewed China EV price wars compress gross margin before scale benefits arrive — the primary DCF lever.

risks.title: Dilution risk
risks.detail: Capital raises (equity / convertibles) if operating losses persist erode per-share value even if EV improves.

risks.title: Opex intensity
risks.detail: R&D + SG&A don't scale down with revenue — delays the profitability ramp and kills the margin path.

risks.title: FX (USD/CNY)
risks.detail: USD returns diverge from RMB economics if CNY depreciates; all revenue is RMB-denominated.

risks.title: Demand / ASP mix
risks.detail: Mix shift toward lower-ASP models or weaker demand reduces vehicle margin and average selling price.

risks.title: Execution risk
risks.detail: New model ramps, supply chain disruptions, or software quality issues break the delivery growth path.

risks.title: Geopolitical shocks
risks.detail: US–China tensions raise the equity risk premium and compress the valuation multiple across the board.

risks.title: Refinancing risk
risks.detail: Debt/convertible maturities under pressure if cash burn returns; effective cost of debt rises vs. modeled.

catalysts: Full-year earnings release clarifying margin trajectory and cash burn rate
Evidence of sustained gross margin improvement and opex discipline
Funding events (equity/convertible issuance) that change the dilution math
January 2026 deliveries of 27,182 — up 96.1% YoY — signal continued volume momentum
managementQuestions: What concrete cost actions make the opex ratio structurally lower — not temporary?
What gross margin floor is realistic under continued China EV price pressure?
What is the capital plan if profitability slips — equity vs. convertibles vs. asset sales?
How should investors think about battery swap economics and its margin contribution?
What delivery + mix assumptions underpin management's internal break-even plan?
